correspAction.name: the New South Wales Leichhardt Search Fund

head.supplied: [An interesting letter was read from Dr. Mueller, of Melbourne, in which it was stated that the Government had promised the Ladies' Victorian Committee a sum of £500, towards the Leichhardt Search Fun...

div.p: To the New South Wales Leichhardt Search Fund

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from 'New South Wales Leichhardt search fund', Sydney morning herald, 15 July 1865, p. 4, a report of the meeting of the committee of the Fund held on 14 July 'at Mr. Hetzer's', much of which was concerned with planning fund-raising concerts and noting 'influential gentlemen' who had agreed to join the Committee.

p.seg: [An interesting letter was read from Dr. Mueller, of Melbourne, in which it was stated that the Government had promised the Ladies' Victorian Committee a sum of £500, towards the Leichhardt Search Fund.]
